conclusion: Car A accelerates uniformly from t = 0 to 10 s up to 40 m/s, then travels at constant speed.
Car B accelerates uniformly from the origin, reaching 40 m/s at t = 20 s, and continues to accelerate.
Acceleration of Car A from 0–10 s is calculated as 4 m/s².
Acceleration of Car B is calculated as 2 m/s².
Displacement of Car A from 0–10 s is calculated as 200 m using the area of a triangle.
Displacement of Car B from 0–10 s is calculated as 100 m using the area of a triangle.
At t = 10 s, Car A has traveled 100 m more than Car B.
Final answer: Car A is ahead of Car B at t = 10 s.
